qas.question: Do incandescent lights emit more, less, or the same amount of light as they age?
What appliance requires more energy due to the use of incandescent lighting?
Do incandescent lights have a longer or shorter life than other lighting sources?
What are some factors to consider in calculating operating costs of lighting?

answers.text: illumination requirements, cost of the lamp and labor cost to replace lamps (taking into account effective lamp lifetime), cost of electricity used

qas.question: What is more cost-effective, heat from incandescent bulbs or heat from a building's heating system?
Whose initial cost is large compared to the cost of the energy it uses over its lifetime?
Whose light emits more light as they age?
What type of light has a longer life span than other sources?
What type of lighting system is less efficient over the course of a year?

context: The initial cost of an <b5_0><b6_0>incandescent<b6_0/> bulb<b5_0/> is small compared to the cost of the energy it uses over its lifetime. <b7_0>Incandescent<b7_0/> bulbs have a <a2_0>shorter<a2_0/> life than most other lighting, an important factor if replacement is inconvenient or expensive. Some types of lamp, including incandescent and fluorescent, emit <a0_0>less<a0_0/> light as they age; this may be an inconvenience, or may reduce effective lifetime due to lamp replacement before total failure. A comparison of <b8_0>incandescent<b8_0/> lamp operating cost with other light sources must include <a3_0>illumination requirements, cost of the lamp and labor cost to replace lamps (taking into account effective lamp lifetime), cost of electricity used<a3_0/>, effect of lamp operation on heating and air conditioning systems. When used for lighting in houses and commercial buildings, the energy lost to heat can significantly increase the energy required by <a1_0>a building's air conditioning system<a1_0/>. During the heating season heat produced by the bulbs is not wasted, although in most cases it is more cost effective to obtain <a4_0>heat from the heating system<a4_0/>. Regardless, over the course of a year a more efficient lighting system saves energy in nearly all climates.
